data.name: List API endpoints
data.description: List information about all API endpoints, or get info on single endpoint (specify name or url).

parameter_descriptions.name: The name of the endpoint (see the full endpoint listing for names)
parameter_descriptions.url: The url of the endpoint to describe (see the full endpoint listing for names)

data.name: Describe properties
data.description: Describe an objects's properties, optionally translated.

responses.description:
Returns a localized description of and object's enumerable properties. If the
                                          property parameter was provided, only this property is described. The returned
                                          object has the property name(s) as key(s) and an object of possibles values as
                                          keys, and localized descriptions as values.

parameter_descriptions.object:
The object to describe. Possible values:

* `User`
* `Address`
* `Email`
* `Phone`
* `Product`
* `BundleItem`
* `Subscription`
* `Content`
* `Discount`
* `Order`
* `OrderItem`
* `Identifier`
* `Transaction`
* `Campaign`
* `Utilities`
* `Voucher`
parameter_descriptions.property: The property to describe. To get a list of possible values, get the full description of an object.

data.name: Platform status
data.description: Get status information from the platform

responses.description: Returns the current status of the API.

data.name: Platform version
data.description: Find out what version you are using

responses.description: Returns a description of the currently deployed SPiD version

data.name: Platform terms
data.description: Returns the current user terms for the client and SPiD

responses.description: The current terms, and whether they are accepted by the user, if a user token is provided.

data.name: Exchange
data.description: Exchanges an authorization code

parameter_descriptions.clientId: The ID of a client belonging to the same merchant as the calling client.
parameter_descriptions.type: The type of exchange. `code` is the only supported type.
parameter_descriptions.redirectUri: The redirect URI must be a registered redirectUri, otherwise the request will be rejected.

data.name: Shorten or lengthen URL
data.description: Create, and expand, short version of URIs

data.name: Utility:adminBySection
data.description: Get list of roles {section}=roles, or acl, {section}=acl

data.name: Utility:aclForRole
data.description: Specify a role (ie `watcher`, `admin`) and get acl list

data.name: Email templates
data.description: Get and Set email templates

responses.description: Returns all the email templates used by the system.

data.name: Create, get or delete data objects by type, id and key
data.description: Data storage endpoint. NB! POST does not work with explorer.

responses.description: Retrieves a previously stored data object. The data object structure is defined by the client who stored it.

parameter_descriptions.type: The base API type to associate data with. One of `user`, `product`, `order`, `discount` or `client`.
parameter_descriptions.id: The ID of the object to associate data with.
parameter_descriptions.key: The unique key of the data object.

data.name: Get or create data objects by type, sub type, id and key
data.description: Data storage sub endpoint. NB POST does not work with explorer

responses.description: Retrieves a previously stored data object. The data object structure is defined by the client who stored it.

parameter_descriptions.type: The base API type to associate data with. One of `user`, `product`, `order`, `discount` or `client`.
parameter_descriptions.id: The ID of the object to associate data with.
parameter_descriptions.key: The unique key of the data object.

data.name: Get, update, and delete data objects by user
data.description: User data storage.

responses.description: Retrieves the data object stored under this key for this user. The format of the data object is entirely dictated by the client and may be of any type.
Returns an object indicating whether or not deleting was successful.

parameter_descriptions.id: ID of the user to associate data with
parameter_descriptions.key: The data object key. Max length is 255 bytes.
parameter_descriptions.value: Data of any kind. Max length is 65535 bytes.

data.name: List data objects by user
data.description: List data objects stored for a user.

responses.description:
Retrieves all data objects associated with this user. Returns an object of data objects. The property names of the 'outer' object is the id of the data object provided as value, e.g.:

```js
{ "[data object id]": { "id": "[data object id]", ... },
  ... }
```

parameter_descriptions.id: ID of the user the data is associated with
parameter_descriptions.key: Only show data for this key. Supports [multiple values](/endpoints/#params).

data.name: List
data.description: Data storage list endpoint.

responses.description:
Returns an object of data objects. The property names of the 'outer' object is the id of the data object provided as value, e.g.:

```js
{ "[data object id]": { "id": "[data object id]", ... },
  ... }
```

parameter_descriptions.key: The client-provided data object key. Supports [multiple values](/endpoints/#params).

parameter_descriptions.email: The email to query status for.

parameter_descriptions.status: Only show successful (`true`) or failed (`false`) logins

data.name: Search digital content
data.description: Search for purchased digital content

parameter_descriptions.userId: Limit results to digital content purchased by this user.
parameter_descriptions.status: Limit results to digital content with this status.
parameter_descriptions.productId: Limit results to digital content for this product.
parameter_descriptions.parentProductId: Limit results to digital content for this product and its child products.
parameter_descriptions.orderId: Limit results to digital content in this order.

data.name: Search KPI
data.description: Search for Key Performance Indicators

parameter_descriptions.name: The name of one or more KPIs to query for, comma-separated. See the list of available KPIs above.

data.name: Create PayLink
data.description: Create a PayLink object

parameter_descriptions.title: The PayLink title. Displayed to the user on the payment page, and shown on the New Credit Card page at Payex.
parameter_descriptions.items: The items to be sold. A list of PayLink Item objects.
parameter_descriptions.clientReference: Your reference. Useful for tracking and processing the Order generated by this PayLink.
parameter_descriptions.purchaseFlow: Defaults to `DIRECT`, which will process the payment straight away. Can also be `AUTHORIZE`, where the payment is on hold and must later be captured.
parameter_descriptions.paymentOptions: The allowed payment methods for this PayLink. An integer bitmask: Credit (1), Credit cards (2), SMS (4), Invoice (8). Defaults to 2.
parameter_descriptions.expires: The date when the PayLink expires. A unix timestamp. Defaults to 24 hours from creation.
parameter_descriptions.redirectUri: Redirect the user to this URL after payment is complete.
parameter_descriptions.cancelUri: Redirect the user to this URL if login or payment is cancelled.
parameter_descriptions.sellerUserId: If set, this user is designated as the seller and will receive the payment.
parameter_descriptions.buyerUserId: If set, only this user has access to the PayLink.

data.name: Get or delete a paylink
data.description: Get or delete a Paylink object

responses.description: A PayLink object, with its status changed to -1 (deleted)

data.name: Search logins
data.description: Query login attemps for a client.

responses.description: A list of login attempt objects.

parameter_descriptions.ip: Filter login attempts by this IP address
parameter_descriptions.status: Filter login attempts by successful (`true`) or failed (`false`) logins
parameter_descriptions.filters: Set to `merchant` to show only login attempts for the current merchant.

data.name: Logout
data.description: Invalidate the user's SPiD session.

responses.description: The response simply says "OK" when the user is logged out.

data.name: Not found error - 404
data.description: Response when requesting an endpoint that does not exist.
